verbose_text: Consistently with Hoseth et al. 9 and Hawdon et al. 10 and with the fact that none of our patients with a neonatal diagnosis had a blood glucose level lower than 11.1 mmol/L (2 g/L), we propose the following index of suspicion should be raised in the following context for NDM suspicion when family cases of diabetes, IUGR, poor weight gain, or dehydration are present as follows : a glycemic threshold in term newborns of 6.2 mmol/L (1.1 g/L) in the first week of life and then 11.1 mmol/L.
